"True Record of Great Man, Marshal Kim Jong Il" (2) off the press
articles.content:
"True Record of Great Man, Marshal Kim Jong Il" (2) off the press
   Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- "True Record of Great Man, Marshal Kim Jong Il" (2) was published by the central standing committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan to mark the holiday of February, the March 23 issue of Joson Sinbo published in Japan said.    The book deals with the immortal exploits of the Marshal. It contains impressive anecdotes and materials.   In the annex under the title "Marshal  Kim Jong Il and the Nation, the World" it recounts  loyalty to him of the people in the North Korea, deep reverence for him of compatriots in South Korea and abroad and boundless respect to him of the progressives of the world.

articles.title: Sun's Day commemorated worldwide
S. Korean chief executive flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean chief executive flailed
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Copies of literature denouncing the present chief executive of South Korea were reportedly found scattered in Seoul on March 22.   More than 4,600 copies of literature were scattered in different parts of Seoul, including Unphyong, Songbuk, Jongro, Songpha and Kangnam districts to draw attention of a lot of people.   Upset by this, puppet policemen were busy tracing the source of the literature.

articles.title: Egyptian preparatory committee inaugurated
articles.content:
Egyptian preparatory committee inaugurated
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- An Egyptian preparatory committee to commemorate Sun's Day was inaugurated in Cairo on March 21 in the countdown to the 87th birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung.   Ahmad Abdul Tawab, chairman of the Administration Council of the Arab Art, Culture and Information Association of Egypt, was selected as chairman of the committee.   The committee decided to arrange commemorations of Sun's Day.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's work published in Cuba
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's work published in Cuba
   Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- "Let Us Bring the Advantages of Socialism in Our Country into Full Play," a celebrated work of the President Kim Il Sung, was published in booklet on March 17 by the Academia Publishing House in Cuba with the approach of Sun's Day.

Japan's active participation in U.S. scheme for war
articles.content:
Japan's active participation in U.S. scheme for war
   Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Asahi Shimbun March 22 said that, in 1994 when the situation on the Korean peninsula was tense, the Japan Defense Agency examined an issue of putting major civilian airports and ports of the country at the U.S. troops' service, according to a report.   The Defense Agency considered placing civilian airports and ports at the U.S. troops' service within a fixed period and claimed that it was possible to hand the U.S. troops the right to manage the facilities, if necessary, the paper said.   Pointing out that such a view still remains relevant, the paper said:   Recently, a high-ranking official of the Defense Agency stated that the facilities might be offered through the application of that view if it is necessary to help in coping with "emergencies in areas surrounding Japan" as envisaged in the bill on updated "guidelines for U.S.-Japan defense cooperation."    This eloquently shows how zealously the Japanese reactionaries are taking part in executing the U.S. plan for a war of aggression on Korea.

articles.content:
Kim Il Chol meets Indonesian ambassador
   Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Chol, Minister of the People's Armed Forces of the DPRK, today met and had a talk with Buchari Effendi, ambassador of the Republic of Indonesia to Korea, who paid a courtesy call on him at the People's Palace of Culture.

articles.title: U.S. decides to offer food to Korea
articles.content:
U.S. decides to offer food to Korea
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S. administration made public on March 22 a decision to offer 100,000 tons of food and an additional 100,000 tons of food for work of potato producers to the DPRK in response to the appeal made by the world food program in December last year.   It is to offer also seed potatoes, fertilizers, agricultural  chemicals and others for potato production.     Such a step is taken by the U.S. administration apart from the offer of 300,000 tons of food now under way.
